title: Day of Rest-Istance
description: We are gathering to unite workers against exploitation, defend our rights, and take back power amidst threats from ICE and governmental defunding.
raw_text:
WE ARE ALL WORKERS - TAKE YOUR POWER BACK - WE ARE ALL WORKERS - TAKE YOUR POWER BACK - WE ARE ALL WORKERS -
MAYDAY! MAYDAY! WORKERS UNDER ATTACK
KILMAR ABREGO GARCIA - ALFREDO “LELO” JUAREZ - ROBERT PANTON - JOSE DANIEL SIMANCAS RODRIGUEZ
Immigrant workers are going missing, being disappeared in broad daylight by the modern American gestapo called ICE. Enemies of state? No, regular people like you and me being dehumanized for profit and political gain.
An injury to one is an injury to us all!
Whose name will be next on Trump’s list of “undesirables”?
Meanwhile, federal workers of essential programs are recklessly dismissed - The workforces of the National Labor Relations Board, The Department of Labor and National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health have been slashed, threatening the livelihood of millions and plunging our country into chaos. Child labor laws are being repealed under the guise of freedom. Why is this happening? To strengthen the working class? No, to pad their bottom line and increase their profits!
Project 2025 seeks to defund the National Labor Relations Board and the Department of Labor to make it easier for businesses to exploit you, the worker.
Will you silently comply, hoping it all works out? Will you watch your coworkers and friends be disappeared and do nothing? Or will you speak up, show up, and take your power back? Resist exploitation and oppression! Workers unite! Defend your rights!
THEY DON’T LIVE PAYCHECK TO PAYCHECK - WHY SHOULD YOU? - THEY NEED US - REMIND THEM
DAY OF REST-ISTANCE MAY 1ST
PSU FARMERS MARKET - 1PM TO 5PM

title: Rally for the Rule of Law
description: We, as lawyers and allies, must speak out to protect our legal system, public’s legal rights, constitutional democracy, and judicial independence. Join us on Law Day to support the rule of law and make your voice heard.
sponsors: The New York City Bar Association
The New York County Lawyers Association
The New York Council of Defense Lawyers
raw_text:
Rally for the Rule of Law

Law Day 2025
Thursday May 1st. 1:00 PM—2:00 PM
FOLEY SQUARE, MANHATTAN

WE MUST PROTECT
• Our Legal System
• The Public’s Legal Rights
• Our Constitutional Democracy
• Judicial Independence

We, as lawyers and allies, must speak out! Come to a rally sponsored by The New York City Bar Association, The New York County Lawyers Association, The New York Council of Defense Lawyers, and many other New York bar organizations and make your voices heard!

We invite lawyers and non-lawyers to join us on Law Day, Thursday, May 1 from 1-2 PM at Foley Square in lower Manhattan to make clear our support for the rule of law.

WE MUST SPEAK OUT AGAINST
Attacking the integrity and independence of judges.
Demanding the absolute right to rule unfettered by laws and appropriate limits to authority.
Intimidating lawyers and law firms by interfering with their ability to represent their clients, terminating their government contracts, and prohibiting them from entering government buildings.
Threatening lawyers so they will not represent certain clients or causes.
Firing government lawyers and investigators simply for doing their jobs.
Punishing lawyers and law firms without Due Process

Lawyers, be prepared to re-affirm your attorney’s oaths!
If you feel comfortable doing so, please dress like you are going to court! Bring your pocket constitution!

JOIN US ON MAY 1ST AT FOLEY SQUARE IN MANHATTAN AND MAKE YOUR VOICE HEARD!
raw_summary: The image describes a public event called "Rally for the Rule of Law" scheduled for Law Day on May 1st, 2025, from 1:00 PM to 2:00 PM at Foley Square, Manhattan. The rally aims to support the legal system, public legal rights, constitutional democracy, and judicial independence. It is sponsored by The New York City Bar Association, The New York County Lawyers Association, and The New York Council of Defense Lawyers. The event invites lawyers and non-lawyers alike to join and show support for the rule of law.

title: May Day Strong: South Bay LA
description: Organized by Indivisible South Bay Los Angeles, this event is a public demonstration advocating for labor rights, fair wages, union protection, and safety for families. It responds to perceived attacks on unions and immigrant families, aiming to build community power.
raw_text:
Sat
3
MAY
May Day Strong: South Bay LA
by Indivisible South Bay Los Angeles
Public event  Movements and politics  may day  protest  workers  unions  labor

About this event
Across the country—from fruit fields in California to classrooms in Chicago, from kitchens in Queens to loading docks in Atlanta—working people are rising up. We are demanding a country that puts our families over their fortunes—public schools over private profits, healthcare over hedge funds, housing over homelessness.

Musk, Trump and their fellow profiteers are trying to create a race to the bottom—on wages, on benefits, on dignity itself. They want to erase labor rights, break our unions, and silence immigrant voices.

May Day 2025 we are fighting back. Organizing for a world where every family has housing, healthcare, fair wages, union protection, and safety—regardless of race, zip code, or immigration status.

They're defunding our schools, privatizing public services, attacking unions, and targeting immigrant families with fear and violence. This is a war on working people, and we will not stand down. This day of action is just the beginning. We're organizing not just for one day, but to build power in every neighborhood, on every shop floor, and in every school.

Location
Torrance City Hall, Torrance Boulevard, Torrance, CA 90503, United States of America
Torrance Boulevard, 90503, Torrance

Date and time
On Saturday, May 3, 2025 starting at 12:00 PM

Organized by
Indivisible South Bay Los Angeles
